title: Memorials of Edinburgh in the olden time
author: Wilson, Daniel
snippet: level with the Castle draw-bridge, and then by gradual and easy descent of long flights of stairs, and the more gentle modern slope of Victoria Street, at length reaches The Bowfoot Well in the Grassmarket, will hardly be persuaded that between these two widely different elevations there extended only a few years since a thoroughfare crowded with antique tenements, quaint inscriptions, and still more strange and interesting associations ; unmatched in its historic and traditionary memories by any other spot of the curious old capital, whose memories we seek to revive. Here were the Templar Lands, with their antique gables surmounted by the cross that marked them as beyond the reach of civic corporation laws,

title: Solved Mysteries; or, Revelations of a City Detective
author: Macgovan, James.
snippet: "You might step up the street a bit with me," I quietly suggested, and after another quick glance in the direction of his wife he obeyed. I got to the side of the hand I was now so curiously interested in, and kept there till we were passing up the Bow to Victoria Street, when he suddenly palmed something from it into the other hand. I looked down sharply and suspiciously, and at the same moment heard a metallic clink on the iron grating in front of the shop window which we were passing.

title: Rambles with an American,
author: [Jacques, Edward Tyrell]
snippet: " It ran from the High Street to the Grassmarket. It's gone now, and a curve called Victoria Street occupies part of it. We'll look at it to-morrow.

title: The undertow;
author: Knowles, Robert Edward
snippet: The matron pondered a moment. " I don't think it's likely," she said, " but the nearest to any exact information, you could get at the Headquarters on Victoria Street near the Mansion House, you know."

title: The undertow;
author: Knowles, Robert Edward
snippet: Early the next morning Stephen presented himself again at the Army Headquarters on Victoria Street. Recognized and admitted, he asked the officer who received him for a note of introduction to the official in command of the Army's forces at the Scottish capital.

title: Here and there in the Home Land. England, Scotland and Ireland as seen by a Canadian. ... Profusely illustrated
author: Haight, Canniff.
snippet: Our first walk, commencing in Cannon Street and thence up Victoria Street, brought us out in front of the Mansion House, the residence for the time being of the Lord Mayor. From this we turned down Lombard Street.

title: Wayfaring men;
author: Lyall, Edna
snippet: "I think I had better go next week, and if you will keep Charlie a few days longer I can settle into that flat in Victoria Street which I have the refusal of. I shall manage very well there with my maid, and with Dugald to wait on Charlie; it will be necessary to live a quiet life for many reasons."

title: The Firm of Girdlestone
author: Doyle, Arthur Conan
snippet: "I was going to Victoria Street to change my book, and then to Ford Street."

title: Wayfaring men;
author: Lyall, Edna
snippet: " Slie has had a flat in Victoria Street, but is leaving, Barry Sterne told us. I think he said she had got another flat at Chelsea."
